Crimes.Crime_Name: Violation of the Hague Convention on Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD's decision to refuse reinstatement of refugee claims
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants accused of parental abduction; initial reinstatement request denied; allegations of abuse and instability reviewed
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: RPD's decision found reasonable; judicial review application dismissed
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Alleged wrongful removal of child and failure to provide new evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegations of abuse and instability in country of origin
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Exceptional circumstances supported by new evidence required
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of new evidence or exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Subsequent reinstatement application after prior denial
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No credibility enhancement due to lack of new evidence
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for reinstatement based on changed circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No new evidence presented to support exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Absence of new evidence supporting exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk to child due to international abduction allegations
Crimes.Cause_Description: Parental abduction allegations led to dismissal of refugee claims
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed existing evidence but found no basis for reinstatement
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Hague Convention on Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Issue of lawful custody and residence in France
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Cross-border child custody dispute involving France and Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Existing evidence insufficient without new supporting documentation
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances demonstrated under RPD Rules
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet burden of proof for exceptional circumstances

Crimes.Threat_Source: Parental conduct in removing child across borders
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Wrongful removal from country of habitual residence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Father withdrew refugee claim under pressure
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Assessed as insufficient due to lack of corroboration
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims not substantiated with new evidence
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Risk of harm to child due to unstable environment
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Child as victim of parental conflict
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian immigration and family law jurisdiction
Crimes.Governing_Law: Hague Convention on Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Proper procedure followed for reinstatement refusal
Crimes.Authority: Federal Court authority to review administrative decisions
